turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Natural bond orbital.
turn.1: What is meant by natural bond orbital?
turn.2: (the acceptor) to complete the span of the valence space: The bonding NBOs are of the "Lewis orbital"-type (occupation numbers near 2); antibonding NBOs are of the "non-Lewis orbital"-type (occupation numbers near 0).
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In an idealized Lewis structure, full Lewis orbitals (two electrons) are complemented by formally empty non-Lewis orbitals.
turn.5: Does the orbital change in any way?
turn.6: Weak occupancies of the valence antibonds signal irreducible departures from an idealized localized Lewis structure, which means true "delocalization effects".
turn.7: Can you tell me more about the de localization effects?
turn.8: With a computer program that can calculate NBOs, optimal Lewis structures can be found.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: An optimal Lewis structure can be defined as that one with the maximum amount of electronic charge in Lewis orbitals (Lewis charge).
turn.12: A low amount of electronic charge in Lewis orbitals indicates strong effects of electron delocalization.
